function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential aerosol transmission of respiratory diseases in indoor spaces.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease spread and infection in poorly ventilated areas.","Mitigation":"Improving ventilation systems and air filtration, reducing air recirculation.","Technologies":"High-efficiency particulate air (HEPA) filters, advanced ventilation systems, air purification technology.","People":"Occupants of buildings and indoor spaces, healthcare workers, general public.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, public health authorities."},{"Description":"Impact of architectural and urban design on disease transmission.","Impact":"Urban design, building layout, and public space design can contribute to or mitigate disease spread.","Mitigation":"Implementing design changes to promote ventilation, reduce crowding, and enhance sanitation.","Technologies":"Urban planning software, architectural design tools, building information modeling (BIM).","People":"Architects, urban planners, public health officials, building owners.","Owner":"Architects, urban planners, building owners, public health authorities."},{"Description":"Contradictory principles in urban planning and public health during pandemics.","Impact":"Conflicting goals in urban design and public health measures can exacerbate disease transmission.","Mitigation":"Adapting urban planning principles to align with public health guidelines, promoting flexible design strategies.","Technologies":"Simulations and modeling software, data analytics for public health, interdisciplinary collaboration tools.","People":"Urban planners, public health officials, architects, policymakers.","Owner":"Urban planning authorities, public health agencies, government bodies."}]}
